game.deck: The band-focused rhythm game returns for the Xbox One and PlayStation 4. Focusing on the core vocals, drums, guitar, and bass instruments, Rock Band 4 will offer a new set of on-disc songs while supporting players' existing DLC libraries.
game.description:
Overview

Five years after Rock Band 3, and three years since the release of Rock Band Blitz, Rock Band 4 brings the Rock Band franchise back to consoles. This is the first entry to appear on the Xbox One and Playstation 4. Rock Band 4 will remove the pro guitar and keyboard features introduced in Rock Band 3, with Harmonix stating that they want to focus on the core vocal, guitar, bass, and drum features. However, pro drums and vocal harmonies will be supported.

The game will make changes to the previous Rock Band formula by allowing for "freestyle" vocals, which give players score for skillful improvisation on vocals. Songs can be strung together into "shows," where crowds may ask for encores and between-song banter lets vocalists earn some extra points for working the audience. Drum fills have a new dynamic option that feeds drummers new drum fills to activate overdrive. This can be toggled to "static," which feeds drummers the existing drum fills.

Mad Catz will put out a new set of instruments that will come bundled with the game, promising better build quality for more precise control. Mad Catz plans to release a "band in a box" bundle that includes the game, a microphone, a wireless drum kit, and a guitar. Also, they will release a guitar bundle that includes the Stratocaster controller and a copy of the game.

Those who attended PAX East 2015 were able to pre-order a special Penny Arcade branded guitar.

Some legacy instruments will also be supported, presumably through a dongle on some systems.

Songs

Harmonix has said that previously purchased downloadable content for Rock Band games (which includes songs exported from other Rock Band games) will be supported at no additional cost as those songs become available on the new platforms. However, this will only work on the same console family. So songs purchased on Xbox 360 will only be playable on Xbox One & songs purchased on Playstation 3 will only be playable on Playstation 4. Rock Band 4 will also feature a new set of 60 on-disc songs as well.

game.deck: The third installment in the mainline Danganronpa series.
game.description:
Overview

Danganronpa 3 was first teased with the announcement of Danganronpa Another Episode: Ultra Despair Girls at Tokyo Game Show 2013 and later confirmed to be in development by the series writer Kodaka Kazutaka in March 2015. The game was officially revealed at Sony's Tokyo Game Show presentation on September 14, 2015 under the title "New Danganronpa V3." It is the first game in the series to be released on a home console.
game.name: New Danganronpa V3: Minna no Koroshiai Shingakki

Overview

Butasan (also known as Psycho Pigs U.X.B, Mr. Pig, and Pig Bombers) is an action game originally developed by NMK Co. and published by Jaleco for the arcade.

The game was later ported to the Amstrad CPC, Commodore 64, Genesis, MSX, Sharp X68000, ZX Spectrum, and PlayStation 4.
game.name: Butasan

game.deck: Yooka-Laylee is a spiritual successor to classic 3D platformers, such as Banjo Kazooie, from former RARE developers at Playtonic Games. Playtonic crowdsourced the game's funding through Kickstarter, achieving their goal within 40 minutes.
game.description:
The game stars a chameleon named Yooka and a bat named Laylee who team up together in a similar fashion to Banjo and Kazooie. It is developed by Playtonic Games, a team made up of former Rare veterans responsible for the Donkey Kong Country series and the Banjo-Kazooie series. On July 30 2015, it was announced that Playtonic had partnered with Worms-creators Team17 to publish the game. They are also looking into a retail release due to Team17's experience in that area.

Kickstarter Campaign

On May 1 2015, Playtonic Games launched its crowdfunding campaign on Kickstarter for Yooka-Laylee with a funding goal of Â£175,000 which was reached within 38 minutes, racing to the final Â£1 million stretch goal and passing it within less than a 24 hours, ensuring a simultaneous release on all platforms.

The Playtonic guys have been upfront about the intentions with this campaign, stating that they had ensured enough personal funds to take them through development of the game regardless and the Kickstarter would only help them expand the game and bring it to consoles faster.
game.name: Yooka-Laylee

game.deck: An upgraded version of Guacamelee!: Gold Edition, complete with all of the DLC, and new levels and abilities exclusive to this version. Known as the definitive version of Guacamelee
game.description:
Overview

This new edition of the game bundles all the DLC, features exclusive new skills and levels, and was released on PS4, Wii U, Xbox 360 and Xbox One July 2nd, 2014. The Wii U port was developed by Broken Rules.

This version of the game also includes an expanded story with new playable areas like the Canal de las Flores featuring new enemies and a new boss, El Trio de la Muerte. New abilities are also available in Super Turbo Championship Edition including INTENSO, Chicken Bombs, & Shadow Swap. The support for multiple save slots and a dual currency system were also added.

  • INTENSO - A rage combat ability that makes Juan more powerful. INTENSO has its own meter and when activated releases a burst of energy that damages nearby enemies.
  • Chicken Bombs - While using his Pollo Power Juan can lay eggs that explode. With the addition of this skill comes new destructible purple blocks in the environment.
  • Shadow Swap - A menu option for cooperative play which gives each player the independent ability to change between the light and dark worlds.

The following is a list of additional features brought to Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition

  • Non-Stop Fighting Action. An extensive move list, advanced combo engine, and anti-gravity grabs
  • Combat moves double as movement, uniting platforming and fighting in a way never seen before
  • Drop in/out 4-Player local co-operative play, featuring independent dimension swapping
  • Multiple boss characters (each with unique back stories), wide range of foes, and elite-class enemies
  • Spectacular player abilities: The Rooster Uppercut, Frog Slam, and âIntensoâ turbo-combat mode
  • Steam leaderboards, achievements and trading cards, support for multiple save slots, persistent cross-save-game costume unlocks
game.name: Guacamelee!: Super Turbo Championship Edition

game.deck: This is the 2015 edition of the F1 racing game by Codemasters for current generation consoles and PC.
game.description:
Overview

F1 2015 is the first F1 racing game to launch on current generation consoles as well as the PC.

The game will feature "all-new presentation" to give the player the real feel of a complete race weekend in F1 and will run on a brand new version of the EGO engine.

Codemasters has also opted to utilize both the Kinect and Playstation Camera (or select headsets) in order for players to talk directly to their race engineers during their time on the track. The ability to ask for information regarding the race, the weather, and your own car will be an option for the very first time.

While the game will release during the 2015 season, Codemasters will also be including the 2014 season as an additional extra for players to try out. This will include 2014 cars, drivers, and tracks.

Playable modes known of at this time include the following -

  • Championship Season Mode
  • Pro Season Mode
  • Quick Race
  • Multiplayer
game.name: F1 2015

game.deck: A "true sequel" to the original Steins;Gate that takes place in the distant future on an alternate timeline.
game.description:
Overview

Steins;Gate 0 is a spin-off to the visual novel franchise that was advertised by the creators as the "true sequel" to the original Steins;Gate. The game does not continue after the true ending of the first Steins;Gate but instead takes place in an alternate timeline set in an dystopian future. Nitroplus and 5pd teamed up once again to develop Steins;Gate 0 and the title was released for the PlayStation 4, Vita, and PS3 in Japan on December 10, 2015.
game.name: Steins;Gate 0
